title: At-Home Vaccinations | COVID19
description: The City of Chicago is working to integrate mobile home health care vaccination services to reach home-bound individuals who are unable to go to the City's COVID-19 vaccination sites to get the vaccine.
cleaned_text: Vaccination Program ELIGIBILITY In-home vaccination is available to all Chicago households and anyone 6 months and up is eligible to receive a vaccine. Up to 10 people can be vaccinated at a time, so Chicagoans can invite family, friends, or neighbors to their home to be vaccinated together. VACCINE Moderna (age 6 months through 5 years) and Pfizer (age 6 months and older). Flu shots are also available as long as one resident registers to receive the COVID-19 vaccine. HOURS OF OPERATION: Appointments are available 2 days a week, Saturday and Sunday, 8am to 6:30pm. REGISTRATION: Call [312.746.4835](tel:312.746.4835) to make an appointment or register using the links in the table below. Appointments are made by Community Area - just click the link below associated with your region to schedule an appointment.
